ygData.subject: RE: Observations: Upper & Lower Guk
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Almost forgot.  I m usually grouped with a lot of tanks.  In LGuk it s usually 2 or 3 paladins with ghoulbanes, a warrior with an executioner s axe, and a
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 28 Oct 1999, James Schuldes wrote:
>
> The froggie knights were no problem and even mulitple pulls were no problem.
> Our enchanter handled all the crowd control. My job was anthem, melee some
> (Staff of Writhing procs DD of 48 non-melee plus hits pretty well on its
> own), mana song & after combat heals.

Almost forgot. I'm usually grouped with a lot of tanks. In
LGuk it's usually 2 or 3 paladins with ghoulbanes, a warrior
with an executioner's axe, and a ranger with various procing
weapons. Since I'm usually doing crowd control or buffing
resists, I'm not using my weapons anyway, so (on the dead
side) I usually use Chant of Battle (with drum) instead of
Celerity. Those weapons proc a lot more, usually 2-3 times a
fight each (and a couple extra procs from ghoulbane pretty
much equals the damage I could do with my weapons). Of course
if I can spare the song slot, I use both. And on the live
side I usually prefer Celerity and join in the fighting.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
